name: g_d6_f17
rowTexts: Light hidden photon production in high energy collisions

name: g_d6_f18

name: g_d6_f18
rowTexts: Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology, Dolgoprudny 141700

name: g_d6_f23
rowTexts: The visible and dark sectors of particle physics can be conne
cted via kinetic mixing between ordinary and hidden
photons. If the latter is light its production in high energy
collisions of ordinary particles proceeds via oscillation
ordinary photons similarly to the neutrino processes. Gene
rically, the experiments are insensitive to mass of the hidd
vector, if it is lighter than 1 MeV, and it does not decay into

name: g_d6_f23
rowTexts: -pair. Still, one can use the missing energy and
scattering off the detector material as signatures to search
for the light vectors. Presence of media suppresses product
of the light vectors making the experiments insensitive to t
he entire model. We present analytic formulas for the light
hidden photon production, propagation and detection valid
for searches at colliders and beam-target experiments and
apply them to estimate the impact on the sensitivities of a se
t of experiments — NA64, FASER, MATHUSLA, SHiP,
T2K, DUNE, NA62 — in a zero-background case.

name: g_d6_f28
rowTexts: New physics can involve GeV-scale and even lighter particles, the pat
tern argued to be preferable when the gauge hierarchy
problem is addressed [1, 2].  These new particles can be directly searc
hed for in high-intensity collision experiments
operating at collider or fixed-target facilities. They include universa
l experiments like those running at the LHC, long-
baseline neutrinos oscillation experiments exploiting proton beams inc
ident on target (DUNE, T2K) and specially designed
projects with high-intensity beams dedicated to new physics huntin
very light particles are concerned, astrophysical processes exh
ibit a higher sensitivity than the direct searches, but the
latter naturally earn a higher confidence, and we concentrate on t
The new particles, if light, must be singlet with respect to the gauge g
roup of the Standard Model of particle physics
(SM). Otherwise, absence of their traces in numerous experiment
s performed so far would be difficult to explain. If the
new singlet is a Lorenzian vector,

name: g_d6_f28
rowTexts: , its most natural effective interaction with the SM fields is via so-calle
— renormalizable mixing between the gauge-invariant kinetic terms of

anism operating in the hidden sector.

en photon phenomenology associated with the

kinematically allowed. The hidden photon can also effectively scatter o
ff the electrically charged SM particles because of
